title: Why is Christianity predominantly a Western religion and Islam an Eastern religion despite both being founded in the Middle East? - Quora

response.answer_text: Why is Christianity predominantly a Western religion and Islam an Eastern religion despite both being founded in the Middle East? Very good answers so far, especially Mr. Man’s. I just want to add the timeline factor. Christianity did not start out focusing only on “the West.” Its earliest adherents were in the Levant — part of the Middle East — and it spread in all directions from there, including to Egypt and the rest of North Africa to the direct west, Ethiopia (in Africa) and Arabia (in Asia) to the south, all the way to Yemen, and eastward into Persia (which had been, at that time, largely of the Zoroastrian religion), and into India — all long before the rise of Islam. (For instance, tradition has it that the Apostle Thomas — the “doubting” one — brought his mission all the way to India.) During that time period, the first 6 centuries of the Common Era, Judaism was also fairly widespread, and populous, as well, including in all those areas just mentioned. What happened in the early 7th century was that Mohammed gathered sufficient followers who presented a new view of the revelations that had already been made in the Jewish and Christian scriptures, while claiming that the Jews and the Christians had perverted the message and gotten it wrong, so that when the local Jews and Christians failed to accept that Mohammed’s revelation was a Godly refinement of their own beliefs and agree to accept Mohammed as their prophet, the followers of Mohammed (who came to be known as Muslims) turned upon and conquered the Jewish and Christian kingdoms of the Middle East, and converted (either voluntarily, or by the sword) most of the remaining Jews and Christians in their new realm. So, it’s more accurate to say that Christianity spread in all directions after its inception; while, 6 centuries later, Islam also tried to spread in all directions and did supplant Christianity as the dominant religion in Arabia, the rest of the Middle East and North Africa, Iberia, and most of South Asia, until its expansion into Europe was stopped militarily, as dramatically described by Mr. Man’s answer.
